title: Oahu Activity News for the Summer of 2015
text:
Expert Videos US Navy's Blue Angels. US Navy Photo 
The island of Oahu is teaming with fun-filled activities that everyone can enjoy. Visitors to Oahu can explore Hawaii’s special culture and iconic history, or choose from a wide variety of outdoor and indoor activities that are sure to energize the spirit. Let’s see what’s new for the summer and early fall of 2015. 
Bishop Museum The Bishop Museum honors the legacy of Hawaii Olympic swimming champion and ambassador of aloha, Duke Paoa Kahanamoku , with a special exhibit, running August 8 – November 2 , 2015 in the J. M. Long Gallery. Visitors can feel the rush of Duke’s legendary mile-long surfboard ride at Waikiki in 1917 via a virtual reality 3D experience, or compete to break his 1920 Olympic men’s 100-meter freestyle swimming record with a tabletop upper-body pedal exerciser. BishopMuseum.org 
Also the museum’s popular Dinosaurs Unleashed exhibit has gained a new character. Now through September 6, 2015 on Saturdays and Sundays at 10:30 a.m., Bishop Museum’s Face-to-Face Encounter will allow visitors to get up close with Nalala the gorgosaurus to learn about dinosaur biology, anatomy, movement and behavior. The dinosaur is actually a 15-foot long, full body costume that the museum’s trained staff bring to life. With complex internal mechanics and audio effects, the costume is extremely realistic, giving visitors a very convincing experience of a close-up dinosaur encounter. You can learn more about dinosaurs with About.com’s Dinosaurs expert Bob Strauss . 
CLIMB Works Keana Farms CLIMB Works Keana Farms , located on Oahu’s North Shore, added their final and longest zip line of over 2,500 feet this June. With this new addition, the full tour now consists of eight dual ziplines, an ATV adventure to the ridge top, four sky bridges and boardwalks, two rappels and a rope climb. This guided tour takes participants soaring over a working agricultural farm nestled in between the North Shore's famous beaches and lush mountains. 
East-West Center Gallery The East-West Center Gallery presents A Common Thread: Textiles from the East-West Center’s Permanent Collection , now through Sept. 20, 2015. In honor of the gallery’s 20th anniversary and the East-West Center’s 55th anniversary, the exhibition features a selection of textiles rarely seen by the general public, including new works recently donated and never before exhibited including batik from Indonesia and Malaysia, embroidered clothes from China, Japanese kimono, carpet weaving from Iran and more. 
Hawaiian Ocean Adventures Hawaiian Ocean Adventures has announced a partnership with Holokai Kayak & Snorkel Adventure and has opened a second location at Heeia State Park in Kaneohe Bay. The new location will focus solely on its Hawaiian sailing canoe adventure: a half day activity that includes a Hawaiian food plate lunch and complimentary pick up and drop off in Waikiki. All proceeds from Holokai go back to Heeia State Park as well as various youth programs through Kamaaina Kids. 
Hoku Hawaii Tours Hoku Hawaii Tours is a new luxury tour line on Oahu designed for visitors interested in exploring the island’s rich cultural, historic and scenic wonders at an exceptional level of comfort and service. A division of Roberts Hawaii, Hoku Hawaii Tours offers five all-inclusive Oahu excursions; each one featuring custom-designed luxury mini-coaches and highly trained local guides called Navigators. 
Kaneohe Bay Air Show Marine Corps Base Hawaii has officially announced plans to host an Open House and Air Show on October 17-18, 2015. This year’s show will feature the U.S. Navy’s premier flight demonstration team, the Blue Angels, along with many other professional performers. The air show will also offer static displays of vintage and modern aircraft, food booths and a carnival midway for the kids featuring rides, games and more. The event is open to the public with free admission and free parking. 
Sea Life Park Sea Life Park has rolled out two enhancements this summer. Beginning July 1, visitors have experienced the enhanced Shark Trek Adventure . The fence that once separated guests from the sharks will be removed, making the encounter even more thrilling. Additionally, the walk-through entrance has been upgraded with new signage, educational information and artwork that celebrates the sharks’ role in Native Hawaiian culture. In mid-August, the park will unveil its $1 million renovation of the Touch Pool . The interactive attraction will nearly double in size and feature new marine creatures for guests to meet. 
State Foundation on Culture and the Arts The State Foundation on Culture and the Arts is commemorating 50 years of supporting arts and culture in Hawaii with a family celebration and new art exhibit at the Hawaii State Art Museum. On August 8, 2015, the foundation will host a festival with live entertainment, demonstration booths, art classes and food booths. Following the celebration, on September 5, 2015, a new exhibition will open featuring the foundation’s Art in Public Places Collections . Book Your Stay
